channel.title: [PI] Adding a world map to your server
channel.description:
Hello fellow Moparscapers, today I am going to be teaching you how to add fully working, full functional maps to your server.
Here is some media
[img]http://puu.sh/1GYzR[/img]
[img]http://puu.sh/1GYAY[/img]
[img]http://puu.sh/1GYBw[/img]
Okay, so before we get started, I would like to say I am not the creator of the application, however I did create a jar and a batch file for you. I do not know who made it as I ripped it from an old 317 cache I had lying around. Full credits to the creator for the application. I also spent a reasonable amount of time researching to see if I could find the creator.
This map launches another java application, so it's like a little pop up.
Lets get in to it
Create a new windows batch file and name it whatever you like.
Insert this code in to it
[code] @echo off title Map cd C:\mycache\WorldMap START javaw -jar WorldMap.jar exit [/code]
Now, the
[code]cd C:\mycache\WorldMap[/code]
Means cd (Change directory) to c:\mycache\worldmap
You will need to locate to your cache, for example
[code]cd c:\users\you\insidiaxcache\worldmap[/code]
Now we will move on to the actual application.
Download the application from
http://uppit.com/ctb9ise95dmo/WorldMap.rar
Then, extract the contents of the folder into your cache folder,so extract it into for example
insidiaxcache
not insidiaxcache/sprites etc
Now you are done, when the batch file you created or the application is run, the world map will launch.
Enjoy.

item.title: [PI] Adding a world map to your server
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Tezzo:

Does anyone still have this File? i’d like to use it and the links are down.

This is old as fuck but here you go [URL=http://uppit.com/ftbquuhcxbid/worldmap.zip]worldmap.zip - 373 KB[/URL]

Read full topic

someone tell me how to do it i suck with clients LOL

item.title: [PI] Adding a world map to your server
item.dc:creator: @PvPXile PvPXile
item.description:
@PvPXile wrote:

[quote=“thock321, post:8, topic:476988”][quote author=PvPXile link=topic=595179.msg4191275#msg4191275 date=1356834851]

So you just took a world map and put it here? Also this would be ‘Adding a world map to your client’ assuming you’d want to put it in your client. This isn’t JUST for PI. It would work for non-renamed clients, too… It would work with anything at all because it’s not programmed into anything.

Sorry about that, i’m so used to PI.

No this is not just a world map java application, you can write a method so when the world map is clicked the jar is run.

Yeah you could. Then there would be a purpose to this topic. The jar isn’t yours nor is the batch file, also the batch file is completely useless.

I have the method and a map which loads inside the client, also the jar and batch is mine. The batch file is used to load it easily.

Proove to me it isnt mine or f off
[/quote]
It’s not hard to make a method which loads this world map.[/quote]

Dat four lines of code, I mean come on.

I don’t want jars etc in my client, so I made a batch.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Adding a world map to your server

Sorry about that, i’m so used to PI.

No this is not just a world map java application, you can write a method so when the world map is clicked the jar is run.

Yeah you could. Then there would be a purpose to this topic. The jar isn’t yours nor is the batch file, also the batch file is completely useless.
[/quote]

I have the method and a map which loads inside the client, also the jar and batch is mine. The batch file is used to load it easily.

Proove to me it isnt mine or f off[/quote]
It’s not hard to make a method which loads this world map.

So you just took a world map and put it here? Also this would be ‘Adding a world map to your client’ assuming you’d want to put it in your client. This isn’t JUST for PI. It would work for non-renamed clients, too… It would work with anything at all because it’s not programmed into anything.

Prove to me this IS yours or ‘f off’.

@PvPXile wrote:

Hello fellow Moparscapers, today I am going to be teaching you how to add fully working, full functional maps to your server.

@echo off
title Map
cd C:\mycache\WorldMap
START javaw -jar WorldMap.jar
exit

Now, the

Means cd (Change directory) to c:\mycache\worldmap

insidiaxcache
